title: Indian Doctor Arrested In US For Taking Videos Of Naked Children, Adults
content: A 40-year-old Indian doctor was held in a US jail on a USD 2 million bond after being charged with multiple sex crimes for allegedly recording hundreds of nude images and videos of children and women over several years, according to media reports.
summary: A 40-year-old Indian doctor was held in a US jail on a USD 2 million bond after being charged with multiple sex crimes for allegedly recording hundreds of nude images and videos of children and women over several years, according to media reports.

title: Misogynist Influencer Andrew Tate's Romania House Raided Over Rape Charges
content: Romanian authorities on Wednesday searched the home of controversial influencer Andrew Tate, who is awaiting trial over human trafficking and rape charges, as part of a new investigation, officials said.
summary: Romanian authorities on Wednesday searched the home of controversial influencer Andrew Tate, who is awaiting trial over human trafficking and rape charges, as part of a new investigation, officials said.

title: Pro-Palestine Democrats Welcome Biden's Exit But Side-Eye Kamala Harris
content: Though there are only a handful of them among thousands of delegates, the "Uncommitted Movement" delegates at the Democratic National Convention are among the most vocal. They plan to voice their discontent with the war in Gaza at the convention.
summary: Though there are only a handful of them among thousands of delegates, the "Uncommitted Movement" delegates at the Democratic National Convention are among the most vocal. They plan to voice their discontent with the war in Gaza at the convention.

title: 'AI Scientist' Writes Science Papers Without Human Input. That's Concerning

title: Crocodile Kills Bathing Woman In Indonesia, Its Belly Cut Open For Body Parts
content: A crocodile killed a woman bathing in a river in eastern Indonesia, police and locals said Wednesday, with villagers later recovering parts of her body from the slaughtered animal.
summary: A crocodile killed a woman bathing in a river in eastern Indonesia, police and locals said Wednesday, with villagers later recovering parts of her body from the slaughtered animal.

title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh In US From August 23-26. Here's The Agenda
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will be on a four-day visit to the US beginning Friday to further boost the comprehensive global strategic partnership between the two countries.
summary: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will be on a four-day visit to the US beginning Friday to further boost the comprehensive global strategic partnership between the two countries.

title: Who Was Daniele Chirinos, Olympian Found Dead After Choking On Food In US
content: Daniela Larreal Chirinos, one of Venezuela's best-known athletes and five-time Olympian, has been found dead at her Las Vegas apartment. The retired cyclist reportedly choked on her food, police said.
summary: Daniela Larreal Chirinos, one of Venezuela's best-known athletes and five-time Olympian, has been found dead at her Las Vegas apartment. The retired cyclist reportedly choked on her food, police said.

title: Russia Shoots Down 11 Drones In One Of Ukraine's "Biggest Attack Ever"
content: Ukraine attacked Moscow on Wednesday with at least 11 drones shot down by air defences in what Russian officials said was one of the biggest drone strikes on the capital since the war in Ukraine began in February 2022.
summary: Ukraine attacked Moscow on Wednesday with at least 11 drones shot down by air defences in what Russian officials said was one of the biggest drone strikes on the capital since the war in Ukraine began in February 2022.

title: Vladimir Putin Inspects Chechen Troops Gearing Up To Fight Ukraine
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Chechen leader Ramzan Kadyrov on Tuesday inspected Chechen troops and volunteers readying to fight Ukraine, the Kremlin said, in what was Putin's first trip in 13 years to the North Caucasus republic.
summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Chechen leader Ramzan Kadyrov on Tuesday inspected Chechen troops and volunteers readying to fight Ukraine, the Kremlin said, in what was Putin's first trip in 13 years to the North Caucasus republic.

title: "Ugly, Misogynistic, Racist Lies": Michelle Obama Blasts Donald Trump

title: Politicians To Be Fined Or Suspended For Bad Behaviour In This Country
content: Politicians in this country could be fined up to 5 per cent of their salary or suspended from the Parliament for bad behaviour under new government workplace laws.

title: Opinion: Indian Americans Cheer Kamala Harris, But Can She Shift Their Votes?
content: For all the enthusiasm about US Presidential nominee Kamala Harris, her shared roots haven't been enough to convert many Indian American supporters of the Republican Party.

title: 28 Pakistani Pilgrims Killed After Bus Overturns, Catches Fire In Iran
content: At least 28 Pakistani pilgrims travelling to Iraq for a Shiite Muslim ritual were killed as their bus crashed in central Iran, state media reported early Wednesday.

title: Kenyan 'Vampire' Serial Killer Escapes From Police Custody

title: World's Oldest Person Dies At 117 In Spain: "She Never Went To Hospital"
content: The world's oldest person, Spain's Maria Branyas Morera, who was born in the United States and lived through two world wars, died Tuesday at the age of 117, her family said.
summary: The world's oldest person, Spain's Maria Branyas Morera, who was born in the United States and lived through two world wars, died Tuesday at the age of 117, her family said.

title: Authors Sue Claude AI's maker For Copyright Infringement Over AI Training
content: The complaint, filed on Monday by writers and journalists Andrea Bartz, Charles Graeber and Kirk Wallace Johnson, said that Anthropic used pirated versions of their works and others to teach Claude to respond to human prompts.
summary: The complaint, filed on Monday by writers and journalists Andrea Bartz, Charles Graeber and Kirk Wallace Johnson, said that Anthropic used pirated versions of their works and others to teach Claude to respond to human prompts.
